source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk1
evidence_span: Tubular samples of Zircaloy-4 clad, of the standard 17×17 PWR design, in the cold worked, stress relieved condition, with a mean wall thickness ξ = 580 μm, and samples machined to reduce their wall thickness to 200 and 80 μm, respectively
composition_raw: Sn:1.44%, Fe:0.19%, Cr:0.10%, O:0.13%, C:0.016%, N:37ppm, H:<5ppm, Trace Impurities:<700ppm, Balance:Zr
conditions: air at one bar pressure, temperatures 623-723 K, exposure periods up to 753 days

extra_properties.wall_thickness: 580±12 μm (Batch A), 200±18 μm (Batch B), 80±18 μm (Batch C)

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk2
evidence_span: Specimens were oxidized in air...Batch A, B, and C

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk2

extra_properties.note: Batch C specimen disintegrated during exposure

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk2
evidence_span: control specimens to evaluate the effect of thermal exposure...Batch A and C

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk2
evidence_span: axial strain, ε_z = δl/l_o...varies systematically with clad thickness

extra_properties.strain_behavior: increases with exposure time and temperature, decreases with clad thickness
extra_properties.specimen_integrity: all intact except Batch C at 723K which disintegrated

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk7
evidence_span: Zirconium alloys have hcp crystal structure with low c/a ratio at and below the reactor operating temperatures and exhibit preferred orientations or textures
test_type: closed-end internal pressurization tests with axial loading, biaxial creep tests
